thread.title: Nokia 8 and P1 concept videos showcase premium design and fingerprint sensors
thread.title_full: Nokia 8 and P1 concept videos showcase premium design and fingerprint sensors

title: Nokia 8 and P1 concept videos showcase premium design and fingerprint sensors
text:
Nokia 8 and P1 concept videos showcase premium design and fingerprint sensors Nokia 8 and P1 concept videos showcase premium design and fingerprint sensors By - February 6, 2017 “The Nokia P1 is expected to be a mid-ranger, while the Nokia 8 will be a flagship offering” 
Last week, Concept Creator posted a YouTube video of the upcoming Nokia P1 concept based on previous leaks. Now the same source has posted another concept video of the Nokia P1 alongside the Nokia 8, which is expected to be a flagship offering. 
Talking about the Nokia 8 concept first, the video reveals that the phone will come with a heart rate sensor, which will be located beside the primary snapper. The device will get a dual-LED flash for the main camera. It will feature slim bezels and a glass back panel, and a physical home button that’s expected to hide a fingerprint sensor beneath. 
The Nokia P1 concept video suggests that it will feature a triple-LED flash on the back. It will feature a metallic frame, slim bezels and a home button, which is also expected to double up as a fingerprint sensor. 
It’s worth mentioning that the concept teaser videos of the Nokia P1 and Nokia 8 are based on preliminary leaks, so they aren’t representative of the final product. HMD Global is expected to unveil these devices at its pre-MWC event on February 26th in Barcelona.
